div.p: The challenge is to detect when a comment from a conversation would be considered insulting to another participant in the conversation. Samples could be drawn from conversation streams like news commenting sites, magazine comments, message boards, blogs, text messages, etc.
The idea is to create a generalizable single-class classifier which could operate in a near real-time mode, scrubbing the filth of the internet away in one pass.
Note: It is important that the comment must be insulting another participant in the conversation. For our purposes, the following are not to be classified as insults:

ul.li: President Mugabe is an absolute idiot
The FCC are a bunch of dickheads

div.p: While these comments are insulting, they are not directed at someone else in the conversation, but distant third-parties or non-persons.
